results.title: Our fragile coast: The Coast, a question of balance
results.creator_credit: David Hughes and Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development
results.brief_description: The first half of this compilation tape focuses on erosion and deposition at Port Campbell, the Gippsland Lakes and Port Phillip, to be used in conjunction with the Earth in Action topic of the Year 12 Geography course; the second shows how competing human interests could destroy the coastal ecology.

results.title: Parental behaviour of fish
results.creator_credit: Cheryl Houben, Michael Sullivan and University of Melbourne
results.brief_description: Shows patterns of breeding and parental care in ciclid fish and encourages the use of aquaria in animal behaviour studies in schools. The first part compares the behaviour of two central American species; the second part presents the strikingly different parental care of an African ciclid.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Cheryl Houben, Michael Sullivan and University of Melbourne

results.title: Guppies in biological control of mosquitoes
results.brief_description: Shows how the combined use of biological and chemical measures enabled Japanese scientists to exterminate noxious creatures without exterminating the environment. Biological control of mosquito larvae is contrasted to chemical methods, indicating that guppies are more effective than pesticides.

results.title: Gill Armstrong
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australian Film Makers”.
Michael Carlton interviews Australian film-maker Gillian Armstrong about her motivations for making films, and discusses some of her productions, in particular “My brilliant career”.

group_siblings.title: Richard Lowenstein on the making of 'Strikebound'

results.title: Tech Talk. Episode 21.
results.brief_description: Contains four programmes designed to help young people in their career choices. Details of what various jobs entail, the necessary qualifications and how to go about getting the job are provided. There is also a segment on survival skills. Presented by Michael Schildberger the topics covered are as follows:- postal clerk, auto electrician, social worker and leisure alternatives.

results.title: Tech Talk. Episodes 19 & 20.
results.creator_credit: John Kyle, Allenog Pty Ltd and Channel 0\28
results.brief_description: A compilation tape containing eight programmes designed to help young people in their carrer choices. There is also a segment on survival skills. Presented by Michael Shildberger, the topics covered are as follows:- surveyor, spray painter, painter and decorator, being out of work-the parents angle, computers - working in the industry, computers - the new age, florist and how to keep that job.

results.title: Tech Talk. Episodes 9 & 10
results.creator_credit: John Kyle, Allenog Pty Ltd and SBS-TV
results.brief_description: A compilation tape containing eight programmes designed to help young people in their career choices. There is also a segment on survival skills The topics covered are as follows:- Zookeeper and Animal technician, Australian History Industry, Permannent part-time work in the Banking industry, Fire-fighting either with the Metropolitan Fire Brigade or Country Fire Brigade, Visual display artist, Bar attendant, Surviving in a city and Buying your fist car. The program is presented by Michael Schildberger

results.title: Backstroke, breaststroke, butterfly, freestyle
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Swimming with Mark Tonelli”.
A compilation tape containing five programmes designed to instruct on swimming techniques. 1.Backstroke. Demonstrated by Commonwealth Gold Medallist Mark Tonelli. 2.Breaststroke. Demonstrated by British Gold Medallist Duncan Tonelli. 3.Butterfly. Demonstrated by Mark Tonelli. 4. Freestyle. Demonstrated by Mark Tonelli. 5.Starts and Turns. Demonstrated by Mark Tonelli and Drew Mayhew.
